This will also keep him in close if you are using circle attack/runes. After movement, shoot shoot move. • Second attack is typically jump attack then immediate meteors. If you can get one shot off in between these attacks go for it, but not at the cost of eating a meteor. After the meteors fall, shoot shoot move. • Lastly, you have the flame shot that splits into 6. The triangle method is perfect to avoid this because it may be a charge. Avoid the flame, possibly shoot, move to avoid the flame spread, shoot again. A rolling bowling boulder attack that eventually splits into 6. The big boulder will also track/follow. , (If this big boulder hits a wall, it will not split and will disappear) A triple rock split. , (Edit) Lastly, he also shoots 5 fast boulders at that are mostly guaranteed hits if you are close to him. , (If you freeze or paralyze him, he will never throw these) • This boss will always throw with his right arm. • My trick is to stand mostly in between him in the center and the wall. This is in the hopes when he tosses the boulder, it will cancel. If it’s the triple rock split you’re still good to go. , • The biggest point is to always rotate to dodge in a counterclockwise direction. This is to have to better chance of dodging the tosses. Specifically, check the ranking rewards, see if you would earn more if you dropped one group below you, and decide whether to stay in your current group or be demoted. How exactly do I demote myself? , , Keep your equipment off in preset and lower your power. Then play and lose. The way to check the rank to be demoted depends on the group. For those in the Supreme group, it is easy to see that you will be demoted if your ranking is lower than the displayed ranking. For those in the Diamond Master group, multiply the number of people being promoted by 3 and get below that rank. As shown in the picture above, the top 20% are promoted and the bottom 40% are demoted. Since the bottom 40% are below the top 60%, the number of those promoted (20%) should be multiplied by 3. Shadowfax88 Legendary Archer 9/26/25, 12:14 PM I'm not positive on this but I'm pretty sure crit damage calculation works like this. All sources of damage that are able to crit have a base crit damage of +50% and additional crit damage is additive to that. Global crit damage works the same way as global crit rate (it only effects main weapon, swords and non explosive meteors). At least this is my understanding but I'm not positive. If you have an enchant for meteor crit damage +30% and that meteor crits it will end up doing 180% damage. I believe the calculation is for explosive meteors is this. Explosive meteor damage (1.25x atk) (explosion multiplier (=3 from xbow) + crit damage multiplier) meteor multiplier (from left side meteor runes) dragoon helm multiplier (=2 if helm is chaotic) (edited) back to this, it is the same for crit dmg right? if i use xbow with meteor and i have meteor crit rate enchant but dont have meteor crit dmg, does the normal crit dmg applies? This is because it prevents someone from sniping you and dropping you in the rankings after you have improved your rankings. And since the arena becomes unplayable 10 minutes before the daily reset, it is recommended to start playing 20-30 minutes before the reset. You could save your tickets and use them all at once on the last day, but I don't know if I would recommend that since you would be wasting 5 tickets each day. Does tickets stack? , , Yes. If you have 0-5 tickets when daily reset, it will reset to 5 tickets. If you have 6 or more, the number won't change. Every day, you can gain 3 more by doing daily tasks, 5 more by buying with gems, 50 more by buying with guild coins. Regarding other modes, ⁠unknown Is there a way to skip the battle? , , The first option is to buy a monthly card. Specifically, check the ranking rewards, see if you would earn more if you dropped one group below you, and decide whether to stay in your current group or be demoted. How exactly do I demote myself? , , Keep your equipment off in preset and lower your power. Then play and lose. The way to check the rank to be demoted depends on the group. For those in the Supreme group, it is easy to see that you will be demoted if your ranking is lower than the displayed ranking. For those in the Diamond Master group, multiply the number of people being promoted by 3 and get below that rank. As shown in the picture above, the top 20% are promoted and the bottom 40% are demoted. Since the bottom 40% are below the top 60%, the number of those promoted (20%) should be multiplied by 3. This will also keep him in close if you are using circle attack/runes. After movement, shoot shoot move. • Second attack is typically jump attack then immediate meteors. If you can get one shot off in between these attacks go for it, but not at the cost of eating a meteor. After the meteors fall, shoot shoot move. • Lastly, you have the flame shot that splits into 6. The triangle method is perfect to avoid this because it may be a charge. Avoid the flame, possibly shoot, move to avoid the flame spread, shoot again. Rinse and repeat EasyVictor ARC2 Senior Archer 5/21/25, 12:20 AM Wednesday, May 21, 2025 at 12:20 AM Flame Demon • This boss will have 3 different attacks: 3x charges. , Jump charge followed immediately by random falling meteors. , Flame Shoot attack that will split into 6 smaller flames that spread outward. , (Typically this is the order of attacks, however, he can skip or repeat) • My method (like with most bosses) is to think of the triangle shape but the orientation does not matter. -also after each movement, get one or two shots off, but never three, it’s too risky. • Using the triangle method is the best way to avoid his 3x charge. A rolling bowling boulder attack that eventually splits into 6. The big boulder will also track/follow. , (If this big boulder hits a wall, it will not split and will disappear) A triple rock split. , (Edit) Lastly, he also shoots 5 fast boulders at that are mostly guaranteed hits if you are close to him. , (If you freeze or paralyze him, he will never throw these) • This boss will always throw with his right arm. • My trick is to stand mostly in between him in the center and the wall. This is in the hopes when he tosses the boulder, it will cancel. If it’s the triple rock split you’re still good to go. , • The biggest point is to always rotate to dodge in a counterclockwise direction. This is to have to better chance of dodging the tosses. If you have 0-5 tickets when daily reset, it will reset to 5 tickets. If you have 6 or more, the number won't change. Every day, you can gain 3 more by doing daily tasks, 5 more by buying with gems, 50 more by buying with guild coins. Specifically, check the ranking rewards, see if you would earn more if you dropped one group below you, and decide whether to stay in your current group or be demoted. How exactly do I demote myself? , , Keep your equipment off in preset and lower your power. Then play and lose. The way to check the rank to be demoted depends on the group. For those in the Supreme group, it is easy to see that you will be demoted if your ranking is lower than the displayed ranking. For those in the Diamond Master group, multiply the number of people being promoted by 3 and get below that rank. As shown in the picture above, the top 20% are promoted and the bottom 40% are demoted. Since the bottom 40% are below the top 60%, the number of those promoted (20%) should be multiplied by 3. Except in pve content Arena Tips & FAQ Game Modes April 13, 2025 EpicJapan | for Help :D ARC2 Chat Mod 4/13/25, 9:22 PM Sunday, April 13, 2025 at 9:22 PM If you have other arena questions, feel free to ask here , What time should I play Arena every day? , , I recommend 20-30 minutes before the daily reset. This is because it prevents someone from sniping you and dropping you in the rankings after you have improved your rankings. And since the arena becomes unplayable 10 minutes before the daily reset, it is recommended to start playing 20-30 minutes before the reset. You could save your tickets and use them all at once on the last day, but I don't know if I would recommend that since you would be wasting 5 tickets each day. Does tickets stack? , , Yes. If you have 0-5 tickets when daily reset, it will reset to 5 tickets. If you have 6 or more, the number won't change. Every day, you can gain 3 more by doing daily tasks, 5 more by buying with gems, 50 more by buying with guild coins. Regarding other modes, ⁠unknown Is there a way to skip the battle? , , The first option is to buy a monthly card. The second option is to press the pause button in the upper left corner right after the battle starts and leave the battle (the result will be reflected). Which build should I use? , , In arena, Dragoon set is recommended. EpicJapan | for Help :D ARC2 Chat Mod 4/13/25, 9:30 PM Sunday, April 13, 2025 at 9:30 PM What is the best strategy when I'm stuck in my current group? , , Deliberately demote one level and achieve a higher ranking in that group. Specifically, check the ranking rewards, see if you would earn more if you dropped one group below you, and decide whether to stay in your current group or be demoted. How exactly do I demote myself? , , Keep your equipment off in preset and lower your power. Then play and lose. The way to check the rank to be demoted depends on the group. For those in the Supreme group, it is easy to see that you will be demoted if your ranking is lower than the displayed ranking. For those in the Diamond Master group, multiply the number of people being promoted by 3 and get below that rank. As shown in the picture above, the top 20% are promoted and the bottom 40% are demoted. Since the bottom 40% are below the top 60%, the number of those promoted (20%) should be multiplied by 3. This impacts main weapon, sword strikes and non-explosive meteors. Elemental base crit rate is determined by luck. If you run lucky shadow, I believe the base rate is 10%. This can be increased by elemental crit rate +% enchants on runes and the elemental crit etched. All other (circles, sprites and explosive meteors) have a base crit of 0%. Specifically, check the ranking rewards, see if you would earn more if you dropped one group below you, and decide whether to stay in your current group or be demoted. How exactly do I demote myself? , , Keep your equipment off in preset and lower your power. Then play and lose. The way to check the rank to be demoted depends on the group. For those in the Supreme group, it is easy to see that you will be demoted if your ranking is lower than the displayed ranking. For those in the Diamond Master group, multiply the number of people being promoted by 3 and get below that rank. As shown in the picture above, the top 20% are promoted and the bottom 40% are demoted. Since the bottom 40% are below the top 60%, the number of those promoted (20%) should be multiplied by 3. Except in pve content Arena Tips & FAQ Game Modes April 13, 2025 EpicJapan | for Help :D ARC2 Chat Mod 4/13/25, 9:22 PM Sunday, April 13, 2025 at 9:22 PM If you have other arena questions, feel free to ask here , What time should I play Arena every day? , , I recommend 20-30 minutes before the daily reset. This is because it prevents someone from sniping you and dropping you in the rankings after you have improved your rankings. And since the arena becomes unplayable 10 minutes before the daily reset, it is recommended to start playing 20-30 minutes before the reset. You could save your tickets and use them all at once on the last day, but I don't know if I would recommend that since you would be wasting 5 tickets each day. Does tickets stack? , , Yes. If you have 0-5 tickets when daily reset, it will reset to 5 tickets. If you have 6 or more, the number won't change. Every day, you can gain 3 more by doing daily tasks, 5 more by buying with gems, 50 more by buying with guild coins. Regarding other modes, ⁠unknown Is there a way to skip the battle? , , The first option is to buy a monthly card. The second option is to press the pause button in the upper left corner right after the battle starts and leave the battle (the result will be reflected). Which build should I use? , , In arena, Dragoon set is recommended. However, many people concentrate on Oracle, so I have created a thread to discuss the rune build for Oracle users. ⁠[Check pinned msg] Arena Build… (edited) Sunday, June 1, 2025 at 9:26 AM 6 Follow Add this post to your channel list and receive notifications about it. EpicJapan | for Help :D ARC2 Chat Mod 4/13/25, 9:30 PM Sunday, April 13, 2025 at 9:30 PM What is the best strategy when I'm stuck in my current group? , , Deliberately demote one level and achieve a higher ranking in that group. Specifically, check the ranking rewards, see if you would earn more if you dropped one group below you, and decide whether to stay in your current group or be demoted. How exactly do I demote myself? , , Keep your equipment off in preset and lower your power. Then play and lose. The way to check the rank to be demoted depends on the group. For those in the Supreme group, it is easy to see that you will be demoted if your ranking is lower than the displayed ranking. For those in the Diamond Master group, multiply the number of people being promoted by 3 and get below that rank. As shown in the picture above, the top 20% are promoted and the bottom 40% are demoted. Since the bottom 40% are below the top 60%, the number of those promoted (20%) should be multiplied by 3. Specifically, check the ranking rewards, see if you would earn more if you dropped one group below you, and decide whether to stay in your current group or be demoted. How exactly do I demote myself? , , Keep your equipment off in preset and lower your power. Then play and lose. The way to check the rank to be demoted depends on the group. For those in the Supreme group, it is easy to see that you will be demoted if your ranking is lower than the displayed ranking. For those in the Diamond Master group, multiply the number of people being promoted by 3 and get below that rank. As shown in the picture above, the top 20% are promoted and the bottom 40% are demoted. Since the bottom 40% are below the top 60%, the number of those promoted (20%) should be multiplied by 3.
